Step

Team Calendars does not render upcoming events on the dashboard if the URL does not end in "/dashboard.action"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49933].
  {panel}

We recently updated our Confluence license from 25 users to 50 users.  However, we didn't update our Team Calendars license.

Team Calendars reported the following error message: _"Team Calendars Plugin's license allows for only 25 active users, but there are 25 of them in Confluence."_

As you can see, this error message isn't helpful.

The real reason for the error is that our Team Calendars license is only for 25 users, but our Confluence license is for 50 users.
fields.summary: Meaningless error message when licensing is incorrect

fields.description:
When embedding Team Calendar macro in a page, there are some amount of extra spaces on the top and bottom of Team Calendar. Team Calendar consumes huge amount of space when set as List as shown in the attachment.
It would save some page area if this space is trimmed so that the content in the next line doesn't have big gap with the Team Calendar macro.
fields.summary: Remove Extra Space Margin In Team Calendar Macro

fields.description: At first presentation of entire month, cells for Monday - Saturday are scrunched up, Sunday is as wide as the other six combined.  If I maximize the window (browser is IE) and then resize, all is well, until next time.  Not a showstopper, just a nuisance.  First noticed this in 5.1.3 but persists in 5.1.5...

fields.description:
*Steps*
* Create an event as monthly repeat and select  30th as a date.
* Go to February it will takes 28th date. 
* Click next month and month after

*Actual*
* it will takes 28 th 

*Expected*
* it must be 30 as user created event date
fields.summary: Repeat event works incorrect

fields.description:
It appears that previously the Calendar macro use to respect the order in which the calendars were selected when displaying the macro on a page.

This issue is to change the macro behaviour so that it displays the calendar legend the same order in which they are selected in the macro. It should be possible to modify this order in the parameter screen of the macro browser.
fields.summary: The calendar legend should respect the order in which you add calendars when embedding calendars on a page

fields.description:
*Preconditions:*
* Create a calendar that named "Verify 1852"
* Create some sub-calendars and events
* The verify 1852 calendar and its sub-calendars are active
 
*Steps:*
* Login to Confluence and go to My Calendar screen
* Click on one sub-calendar to inactive it

*Actual*
* verify 1852 calendar is inactive

*Expected*
* verify 1852 calendar is NOT inactive until all its sub-calendars and events are inactive - it like a check all checkbox (it check when all checkbox are checked, and it uncheck when one of checkboxes is uncheck)

!Screen Shot 2013-12-10 at 9.42.42 AM.png!

!Screen Shot 2013-12-10 at 9.42.55 AM.png!
fields.summary: Calendar is inactive when one its sub-calendar is inactive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49905].
  {panel}

Hello

I just added a team members leave in the new calendar, I got a call from him telling me that he was on vacation that day so he could not come to my "meeting"

I asked him to forward the email to me and there was nowhere to be seen that is was a "leave" type event. Something to add? Please?

Kind Regards
/Henric
fields.summary: Email lack the event type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49903].
  {panel}

When attempting to display a Team Calendar in a deck of cards the Team Calendar is not displayed if the deck of cards does not have the Calendar on the first card that is to be displayed. Attempting to interact with the calendar refreshes and the Calendar information will be displayed.

Contacted the Deck of Cards plugin vendor for resolution and the reported: "After much investigation, we found the Team Calendar does not show up in {localtab group} and {localtab} macros from Navitabs Plugin by bitvoodoo too. Other than that, from our findings Google Calendar macro is displaying fine in any cards of deck.
Thus, we suspect the issue comes from Team Calendar Plugin itself, which is not compatible in tabs. Perhaps you may get proper assistance from its developers here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars#support"

Please investigate and provide a resolution.
fields.summary: Team Calendars to not display when not on first card in a deck of cards

fields.summary: Getting a 500 error when trying to add/view events in Team Calendars
Usernames in Team Calendar's restrictions are not case insensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49892].
  {panel}

This is probably a very rare use case, but [~dluong] noticed it while testing:

1. Import an ical file to create a new calendar in TC.
2. Import the same ical file again to create another calendar in TC.
3. Now drag an event from the first calendar in week or month view.
4. Notice that the corresponding event from the second calendar is also moved.
fields.summary: If two copies of the same ical file are imported then dragging an event from one calendar will also move the corresponding event from the other calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49890].
  {panel}

This seems to be related to existing issues:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1854
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1196
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1285

There are two problems. One is that the events rearrange as your scroll horizontally. This might be considered a matter of preference and is not necessarily a bug. The other problem is that events are not stacked properly, they overlap each other and events are obscured. This is clearly a bug and it makes the timeline view unreliable and therefore unusable.

This calendar of my exhibits the problem:

https://amplify-jira.atlassian.net/wiki/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=5e68abb4-765b-4ca0-8c58-0049e9cdba27
fields.summary: timeline view with event start/end dates displays incorrectly

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
* Create application link between Confluence and JIRA and set a particular JIRA project's available for anonymous access
* Add new Calendar and create two events
** First event type should be set to *Event*, no restriction set
** Second event type should be set to *JIRA Issue Dates*, no restriction set
* Create a space and allow anonymous users to access it
* Embedded the team calendar to newly crated space

After doing above steps, login users can see everything normally.
For anonymous users, there is no event displayed.

However, anonymous users can see the event if the *JIRA Issue Dates* event type is removed.

*NOTE:* Both Team Calendar and Team Calendars JIRA Integration have been installed for both Confluence and JIRA respectively
fields.summary: Calendar doesn't display any event for anonymous users if 'JIRA Issue Dates' event type is added within the same calendar.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49882].
  {panel}

Create a new Calendar in Team Calendars based on JQL.


This works: 
fixversion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() and project in (CRM, EDVCM)

but this does not work:
fixversion = earliestUnreleasedVersion() and category = Echo

The filter above returns results in JIRA, but for some reason is not pulling issues into Team Calendars.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49881].
  {panel}

When [subscribing Confluence Team Calendar in Microsoft Outlook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook], the event is displayed without reflecting timezone difference.

h6. Steps to Replicate
# Login using _User A_ with [timezone setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+User+Settings] GMT+8
# Create a new calendar named *Meeting List* with timezone GMT+8
# Create a new event named *Night Meeting* for '<Today's Date> 20:00 until 21:00'
# Login using _User B_ with timezone GMT+6 (use a PC with timezone GMT+6)
# Add existing calendar *Meeting List*
# *Night Meeting* event will be shown as '<Today's Date> 18:00 until 19:00'
# Subscribe to *Meeting List* calendar to get the ICS Link for Microsoft Outlook
# Open Microsoft Outlook and [subscribe to Confluence Team Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook] by using the ICS Link in the previous step
# In Microsoft Outlook, *Night Meeting* is still displayed as '<Today's Date> 20:00 until 21:00'. It should be displayed as *'<Today's Date> 18:00 until 19:00'*
fields.summary: Event Time doesn't Follow Timezone Difference in Microsoft Outlook

This is with confluence 4.2.5.

To reproduce:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49820].
  {panel}

Hi,
I have multiple calendars in confluence experiencing this issue. A user subscribes to a calendar and syncs it with Outlook. Not all events are synced and some events are overlapped. User reports multiple time zone errors in Outlook.

We are starting to bring this plugin to our production server full time and alot of people are running into this issue when syncing PTO calendars and On Call calendars.  Would love a bump in this one needing this issue fixed ASAP.

Please fix this one soon! This is what I am seeing in Outlook: https://answers.atlassian.com/upfiles/error_18.png


This is a huge blocker because a lot of people rely on the sync between Outlook and team calendars.

# [Subscribe to a calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribing+to+Google+Calendars+From+Confluence]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49812].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

A 500 error displays when opening the calendar view and no calendars are displayed.

Within the following request {{/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendars.json?_=1381923157276}} under {{/calendar/mycalendar.action}} there is the following exception:

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:191)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:127)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:103)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:109)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:293)
	at org.apache.jk.server.JkCoyoteHandler.invoke(JkCoyoteHandler.java:190)
	at org.apache.jk.common.HandlerRequest.invoke(HandlerRequest.java:311)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket.invoke(ChannelSocket.java:776)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket.processConnection(ChannelSocket.java:705)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket$SocketConnection.runIt(ChannelSocket.java:898)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:690)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
"}
{code}

h3. Workaround
This is likely caused by corrupt calendar subscriptions. For Team Cal 4.2 and above the instructions to fix are below.
# First, make a full backup of the database just in case anything goes wrong
# Run this query to remove duplicate calendar subsriptions for the affected user (this will not remove calendars that the user has created, but the user may need to re-add some calendars to their calendar view.
{code}
select id, description from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS 
 where creator = (select user_key from user_mapping where username = 'the-username') 
 and parent_id is not null
  group by id having count(description) > 1;

delete from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS where if in (the ids from step 1);
{code}
# Restart Confluence
# If this doesn't resolve the issue, you can run this query to delete *all* calendar subscriptions for the user. Again, this will not delete any calendars that the user has created, but they will need to re-add all their calendars to their calendar view.
{code}
delete from AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS 
 where creator = (select user_key from user_mapping where username = 'the-username') 
 and parent_id is not null;
{code}
# Restart again

If this doesn't resolve the issue please raise a Support request at https://support.atlassian.com so we can help you out.

fields.description:
We are displaying a People Calendar via list view on one of our pages. While the entries show up correctly in the list, we see bad information upon a single click - which brings up the pop-up with more information. However, when we double click to get the main dialog, the information is correct. The only time it is incorrect is the mini-pop-up after  single click to the list view. 

For example, we have a person on the calendar from June 25-July 1. In list view, the person accurately appears for June 27th. If I single click the entry, the pop-up gives me the dates 30 Jun - 01 Jul (uneditable, as text), which is wrong. However, if I double click the entry, the editable dialog correctly displays Jun 25- Jul 1.
fields.summary: Hover pop-up doesn't display the accurate dates.

fields.description:
When a user changes their timezone in their user profile there events are not updated to reflect this change. The event will remain in their calendar for the time specified when the event was created, even though the user has since updated their timezone in their profile and thus the events should update accordingly.

*Steps to reproduce:*

Set a time zone in your user profile, (for example GMT+1) > create an event in the calendar > set another time in your user profile, (for example GMT-8),  and the events will remain at the time specified from the first timezone.

This causes a lot of problems for Confluence users who travel and expect to be able to update their timezone to reflect their calendar events.
fields.summary: Events don't update following timezone change in user profile

fields.summary: Cannot add JIRA calendars if JIRA's Project Key is equal to a JQL restricted word.
Upcoming events on dashboard should be below "Getting started" (regression)

fields.description:
Steps
* Login with Duy Tran user
* Create a calendar (*) with some events
* Delete this user (Duy Tran)
* Go to My calendar, add this calendar (*)

Actual
* It does not show this calendar My calendar

Expected
* It shows this calendar My calendar

Notes
* Users are able to add this calendar in a page (calendar macro)
fields.summary: Users are unable to add a calendar which its creator does not exist
In the time line view, the event label is only visible when the start of the event is visible

fields.description:
Get the following error when following a calendar preview link (<server>/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=<guid>) and not being authenticated:

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractCalendarDataStore.hasViewEventPrivilege(AbstractCalendarDataStore.java:396)

Should lead to the login screen (leading to the cal preview afterwards) as page links with permission restrictions do.
fields.summary: System Error when going to a calendar and not authenticated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49768].
  {panel}

On any Ondemand instance, Team Calendars can't be edited. When clicking on Edit, nothing happens. There is no way of removing subcalendars of the macro. 

*Notes:*
* it was working properly on previous OnDemand release
* this other issue was worked on regarding the same problem but on a future release: [TEAMCAL-2129|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-2129]

*Workaround:*
# Remove the Calendar
# Save the page
# Create a new Calendar and add the subcalendars needed.
Also, subcalendars can be deselected after saving the page.
fields.summary: Unable to Edit a Calendar

* User able to create a JIRA issue with OAuth mode

fields.summary: User unable to create JIRA issue when Application Links is Trusted mode
Event summaries overflow the containing lozenges in printed week view

fields.description:
Here is the steps to reproduce: 
# Generate an ical export file from Google calendar. 
# import this file into team calendar
# Click over the "See Shane about scheduling" event and click on edit
# Change some information and click on save

It will throw a NPE error on the screen:

The root cause of the issue seems to be that Team Calendar is not able to located the UID for the event. 

*As a workaround solution:* Please edit the ical file with a text editor, remove the charactor "/" in the UID before imported to Team Calendar.
fields.summary: NPE when saving the modification on the event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49762].
  {panel}

Team Calendar restrictions do not apply if the calendar is in a Calendar Macro withing a Confluence page.

+Repro steps:+
# Create a calendar.
# Restrict it to one group.
# Create a Confluence page with a calendar macro containing the restricted Calendar.
# View the page with a user with no permissions to see the calendar.

This bug affects new calendars and also existing calendars after the upgrade to Team Calendar 4.2+.
fields.summary: Restrictions do not apply in calendar macro
Notification not working for event types "Leave", "Travel" and "Birthdays"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49758].
  {panel}

Events are added through Jira.  Jira Issue calendar events are created through Team Calendars.  Some Jira event show up, some do not.  We have waited almost one full day between checking events.
The JQL we are using finds the events in Jira, but nothing shows up in the Team Calendars.
Additionally, some members of the team are seeing event prior to the events being updated, even after a refresh.  This leads to two different people viewing the same calendar and seeing different results, even after refreshing both screens.  Perhaps these two errors are related.
This is blocking our use of this (paid) feature.
fields.summary: New events do not show up in calendars; different users see different events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49757].
  {panel}

Team, I just [got a customer|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-116689] that was pretty confuse on how to update his TC calendar, so I decided to create a KB:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=440599109

However it was moved to another space. So, my suggestion is to add a step-by-step way on how to update TC license here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Licensing+and+Installing+Team+Calendars

(!) PS: After talking with A.Campbell, he suggested to add [~rrobins] in this thread.
fields.summary: Suggestion to add to the TC Licensing and Installing Team Calendars doc

fields.description:
Outlook 2010
Confluence 5.1.5, 5.2.3
Team Calendars 3.2.4, 4.0.3

I can reproduce the problem in a new calendar I created. I followed these steps:
# Create a recurring event that repeats every x days/weeks
# Subscribe to it in Outlook 2010
# The event shows 1 time/per week as expected/same as Team Cal 
# Then change 1 instance of the reoccurring event - ie change the description and refresh the calendar in Outlook 
# Team calendars only shows 1 event with updated description - the new edited event. Outlook refresh shows 2 events - the original event and the edited one 
# I tested the subscription function by subscribing in iCal (mac). iCal displays the event the same as Team Calendars - so the problem is isolated to Outlook.
(i) When I try to delete the event in outlook, I cannot. There is an error message about being able to modify a read only folder. I cannot find an option to enable the ability to modify any event from the Team calendar subscription in Outlook.

Attaching screenshots for reference. I changed the daily meeting event on the 13th to have Daily Meeting - Ryan. Note that outlook now shows 2 events, instead of the 1 that TC shows.
fields.summary: Edited recurring event shows double in Outlook
Team Calendar cannot be edited by a user who have permission
